content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: March 2007: New Century Financial, largest US subprime lender, misses margin calls and files for bankruptcy. HSBC announces $1.8bn additional subprime loss provisions. ABX BBB- 06-01 index drops from 95 to 65 in weeks.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: HIGH - Early subprime contagion phase.

1) INDICATORS: ABX index collapse signals market pricing in 60-70% losses on 2006-vintage BBB- tranches. New Century originated $60bn in 2006 alone. HSBC loss 50% above consensus.

2) CASCADE: 25+ subprime lenders fail by Aug 2007. European conduits (e.g., IKB, Rhineland) funded via dollar ABCP suddenly unrollable.

3) PARALLEL: 1998 LTCM – concentrated risk in ostensibly high-grade structured products.

4) MISSED SIGNALS: Fed minutes March 2007 state 'subprime issues appear contained'.

5) RISK SCORE: US housing 0.82, Banking sector 0.68, Global contagion 0.45 (underestimated).

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: August 9, 2007: BNP Paribas freezes redemptions on three funds holding US subprime MBS, citing 'complete evaporation of liquidity'. ECB injects €95bn overnight, largest in history.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: CRITICAL - First public admission of dollar funding freeze.

1) INDICATORS: Overnight EURIBOR jumps 40bps in hours. CP outstanding drops $90bn in one week. Northern Rock reliant on wholesale funding (75% of balance sheet).

2) CASCADE: UK → Iceland → Ireland → Spain property bubble chain. German Landesbanken hold €400bn+ off-balance-sheet SIV exposure.

3) PARALLEL: 1931 European banking crisis after US credit contraction.

4) QUANTIFIED: Probability of UK bank run within 90 days rises from <5% to 55%.

5) MISSED: Bank of England initially refuses lender-of-last-resort, citing moral hazard.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: September 2008: Russian stock market falls 57% from May peak. Reserves drop $150bn defending ruble. Putin blames 'American financial infection'. Russian oligarchs owe $500bn in dollar debt.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: SEVERE - Commodity superpower vulnerability exposed.

1) INDICATORS: Oil collapses from $147 to $90 in weeks. Russia 70% export revenue oil/gas. Margin calls on pledged shares (e.g., Deripaska, Abramovich).

2) CASCADE: Potential forced asset sales abroad (London property, European football clubs) → political backlash in West.

3) PARALLEL: 1998 Russian default after Asian contagion.

4) RISK: Probability of political challenge to Putin-Medvedev tandem rises from 12% to 38% within 12 months.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: October 2008: Iceland’s three largest banks collapse in one week. Liabilities 10x GDP. UK uses anti-terrorism laws to freeze Icelandic assets. Russia offers $4bn emergency loan.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: EXISTENTIAL for Iceland, geopolitical opportunity for Russia.

1) INDICATORS: CDS on Iceland sovereign jumps from 200bps to 1100bps in days. Kaupthing, Landsbanki, Glitnir funded via UK/Dutch Icesave accounts (€7bn retail deposits).

2) CASCADE: First developed-country IMF program since UK 1976. NATO member effectively bankrupt → Russian influence vector.

3) PARALLEL: 1997 Thailand → IMF → regional resentment.

4) CONTRARIAN: Many analysts viewed Iceland as 'Nordic Tiger' with 5% growth 2003-07.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: March 2009: China holds $2tn in FX reserves, 60% in dollar assets. Premier Wen Jiabao publicly states 'extremely worried' about US Treasuries. Hu Jintao calls for 'new international reserve currency'.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: STRATEGIC - Potential dollar confidence crisis.

1) INDICATORS: US 10-year yield spikes 100bps in Q1 2009 on quantitative easing fears. China stops net purchases of Agencies.

2) CASCADE: Accelerated diversification into gold (PBoC secret purchases), IMF SDR bonds, bilateral swap lines (2009-2013: $500bn+).

3) PARALLEL: 1971 Nixon shock aftermath.

4) QUANTIFIED: Probability of coordinated G20 move against dollar reserve status rises from <5% to 28% within 24 months.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: November 2008: Dubai World requests 6-month debt standstill on $59bn. Nakheel bond due December 2009. Abu Dhabi refuses automatic bailout.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: HIGH for GCC cohesion.

1) INDICATORS: Dubai gross external debt $110bn (120% GDP). 80% real-estate related. Property prices already down 50% from peak.

2) CASCADE: Threatens Abu Dhabi-Dubai federation bargain. Qatar, Kuwait CDS spike in sympathy.

3) PARALLEL: 1997 Korea chaebol debt standstills.

4) OUTCOME: Abu Dhabi eventual $10bn selective bailout December 14, 2009 – sovereignty preserved but hierarchy clarified.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: January 2008: Sovereign wealth funds (Kuwait, Singapore, China) inject $40bn into Citi, Merrill, UBS. Western politicians call for restrictions on SWF investments.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: MEDIUM-HIGH for backlash against Gulf/China capital.

1) INDICATORS: US/EU protectionist rhetoric spikes (Schwab, Sarkozy statements). Germany drafts SWF regulation.

2) CASCADE: Acceleration of 'sovereign leverage' fears → eventual OECD SWF guidelines 2008.

3) CONTRARIAN TAKE: SWFs provided liquidity when no one else would – net stabilizing.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: October 2008: Hungary faces currency collapse. Forint down 25% in weeks. External debt 140% GDP, 90% denominated in CHF/EUR. IMF/EU announce €20bn rescue package.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: CRITICAL - First EU member IMF program since crisis began.

1) INDICATORS: 40% of Hungarian mortgages in Swiss francs → payment shock as forint crashes.

2) CASCADE: Latvia, Romania, Ukraine follow with IMF programs within 6 months (Baltic-Russia contagion vector).

3) PARALLEL: 1997 Asian crisis IMF stigma.

4) MISSED: EU assumed currency board regimes immune.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: 17 December 2010: Mohamed Bouazizi self-immolates in Sidi Bouzid, Tunisia after police confiscate his fruit cart. Local protests erupt same day. Youth unemployment officially 30%, real closer to 42% in interior governorates. Global food price index (FAO) at all-time high, up 32% YoY. WikiLeaks 'Tunileaks' cables released 28 November expose Ben Ali family corruption.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: CRITICAL - Ignition point for regional revolutionary cascade.

1) INDICATORS: Youth bulge (59% under 30), graduate unemployment 45%, interior-coastal inequality >3:1, food inflation crossing 30% threshold repeatedly linked to unrest (1789, 1917, 1977). WikiLeaks stripped remaining regime legitimacy.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Shared Arabic satellite media + Facebook penetration 18-25% = demonstration effect velocity unprecedented. Egypt (Jan 25), Libya (Feb 15), Yemen (Feb 3), Bahrain (Feb 14), Syria (Mar 15) all follow within 90 days.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 1848 Spring of Nations – single spark in Paris → 50 regimes challenged in weeks.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Tunisia regime survival probability drops from 0.92 (Nov 2010) to 0.11 by 14 Jan 2011. Regional contagion probability 0.78 within 120 days.

5) MISSED SIGNALS: IMF Article IV (Jun 2010) called Tunisia 'model performer'. US State Dept praised 'stability' Oct 2010. Analysts fixated on Islamist threat, ignored secular youth vector.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: 25 January 2011: 'Day of Rage' in Egypt. Over 1 million protest in Cairo, Alexandria, Suez. Mubarak cuts internet (85% shutdown via BGP withdrawal). Army refuses to fire on crowds. Youth unemployment 34%, wheat prices up 48% YoY, Egypt world’s largest wheat importer.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: TERMINAL for Mubarak regime.

1) INDICATORS: Tahrir Square occupation exceeds 1:10,000 population threshold for regime collapse (Chenoweth). Military neutrality flips balance of power. Internet cutoff confirms regime panic.

2) CASCADE: Fall of Egypt (GDP $230bn, population 82m) removes cornerstone of US Middle East policy. Saudi Arabia announces $130bn domestic spending package within 48 hours to pre-empt contagion.

3) PARALLEL: 1989 Romania – army neutrality + million-strong protests = dictator gone in days.

4) RISK SCORE: Mubarak survival <0.05 by 11 Feb. Probability of monarchical counter-revolution in GCC rises to 0.62.

5) CAUGHT SIGNAL: Social-media monitoring cells in Doha and Dubai tracked keyword spikes 72h prior.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: 15 February 2011: Protests begin in Benghazi, Libya against Gaddafi. Regime responds with live fire, 300+ killed in first week. Oil production 1.6mb/d begins shutdown. Gaddafi threatens 'rivers of blood'. France recognizes NTC 10 March.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: CIVIL WAR + REGIME COLLAPSE IMMINENT.

1) INDICATORS: Regime uses foreign mercenaries (Chadian, Serbian), tribal east-west fracture activates, oil terminals sabotaged. Brent crude jumps $15 in 10 days.

2) CASCADE: Libya intervention (UNSCR 1973) sets precedent for R2P enforcement, emboldens Syrian opposition, alarms Russia/China (abstention regret).

3) PARALLEL: 1991 Iraqi uprisings – regime survival through extreme violence until external intervention.

4) QUANTIFIED: Probability of NATO-led intervention rises from 0.18 (15 Feb) to 0.94 by 19 Mar.

5) MISSED: CIA estimated Gaddafi survival probability 70% as late as 12 March.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: 14 March 2011: Saudi-led GCC Peninsula Shield Force (1,500 troops) enters Bahrain to protect key installations. Shia protests crushed, Pearl Roundabout demolished. Bahrain GP cancelled.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: REGIONAL SECTARIAN POLARIZATION ACCELERATING.

1) INDICATORS: First foreign ground intervention of Arab Spring. Saudi fears 'Shia crescent' linking Iran-Bahrain-Iraq-Syria.

2) CASCADE: Iran-Saudi cold war goes hot. Yemen Houthi rebellion reignites Apr 2011. Syria sectarian framing hardens.

3) PARALLEL: 1962-70 Yemen civil war – Saudi vs Nasser proxy conflict.

4) RISK: Probability of Iran-Saudi direct confrontation within 24 months rises from 0.22 to 0.61.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: 18 March 2011: First protests in Deraa, Syria after teenagers arrested for anti-regime graffiti. Security forces open fire, 6 killed. Assad dismisses as 'foreign conspiracy'. Drought 2006-2011 displaced 1.5 million rural Sunni to cities.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: HIGH PROBABILITY OF PROLONGED INSURGENCY.

1) INDICATORS: Pre-existing displacement + sectarian governance + youth bulge = perfect storm. Rural Sunni grievance ignored for decades.

2) CASCADE: Becomes regional proxy war (Iran/Hezbollah vs Saudi/Qatar/Turkey). 6.7 million refugees by 2020.

3) PARALLEL: 1982 Hama uprising – crushed in weeks vs 2011 decentralized structure.

4) RISK SCORE: Regime survival 0.88 (Mar 2011) → 0.41 by Dec 2011 → 0.68 by 2024 (Russian/Iranian support).

5) MISSED: UN FAO drought reports 2008-2010 flagged displacement risk.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: November 2010: Jordan sees bread riots after subsidy cuts. Phosphate exports down 25%, tourism revenue -40%. King Abdullah dissolves parliament third time in two years.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: MODERATE but rising – monarchy resilience test.

1) INDICATORS: 40% of population Palestinian origin, youth unemployment 48% in Zarqa/Mafraq. Tribal east-bank base eroding.

2) CASCADE: Jordan stability critical for Israel security and Syrian containment.

3) OUTCOME: Regime survives via $5bn GCC bailout 2011-2013 and constitutional theatre.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: 27 January 2011: Yemen – 20,000 protest in Sana’a against Saleh. GDP per capita $900, oil production down 45% since 2003, water table collapsing, qat cultivation 40% arable land.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: STATE FAILURE INEVITABLE.

1) INDICATORS: Resource depletion + tribal fragmentation + Al-Qaeda presence + Houthi rebellion = no monopoly on violence.

2) CASCADE: Becomes Saudi-Iran proxy war 2015, world’s worst humanitarian crisis.

3) PARALLEL: Somalia 1991 collapse dynamics.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: February 2011: Algeria increases food subsidies by $20bn, imports 8 million tonnes wheat to calm protests. Bouteflika lifts 19-year state of emergency 24 Feb.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: CONTAINED via hydrocarbon rent.

1) INDICATORS: Oil/gas 97% exports, $180bn FX reserves act as shock absorber.

2) CONTRARIAN: Regime survives 2011 but plants seeds for 2019 Hirak when oil price collapses.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: 20 February 2011: Morocco – 300,000 protest nationwide. King Mohammed VI announces constitutional reform committee within weeks.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: SUCCESSFUL PRE-EMPTIVE REFORM.

1) INDICATORS: Monarchy retains legitimacy, military loyalty, $15bn reserves.

2) OUTCOME: New constitution July 2011, Islamist PJD wins elections – controlled decompression.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: October 2010: Qatar’s Al Jazeera Arabic live streams Tunisian protests 24/7, framing as 'revolution'. Facebook penetration in Arab world rises from 12% to 22% in 12 months.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: INFORMATION CONTAGION ACCELERATOR.

1) INDICATORS: Al Jazeera viewership triples in Egypt/Tunisia Dec 2010-Jan 2011. 65 million Arabic speakers under 30 online by 2011.

2) CASCADE: First revolution enabled by satellite TV + social media synergy.

3) PARALLEL: 1989 Eastern Europe – fax + VHS → 2011 Arab world – satellite + Facebook.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: January 6, 2021: Supporters of President Trump storm the U.S. Capitol during certification of the 2020 election results. Over 2,000 rioters breach barriers; 5 deaths result. Polling showed 70% of Republicans believed election fraud; social media amplification reached 100M+ impressions in 24 hours. U.S. GDP contraction 3.4% in 2020 due to COVID.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: CRITICAL - Domestic democratic erosion with international contagion potential.

1) INDICATORS: Protest size exceeds 1:100,000 population threshold for institutional challenge (historical parallel to 1968 Chicago DNC). Republican polling shift: 65% fraud belief in Dec 2020 polls vs 30% in Nov. Social media echo chambers (Parler/Facebook) amplified 5x faster than 2016 election misinformation.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Undermines U.S. soft power credibility (NATO allies express concern; China/Russia exploit via state media). Economic domain: S&P 500 dips 1.4% intraday, signaling investor flight from U.S. stability premium. Military: National Guard mobilization (25,000 troops) strains readiness for Indo-Pacific pivot.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 1933 Reichstag Fire - single event used to justify democratic backsliding and emergency powers.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Probability of contested 2024 election rises from 0.15 to 0.68. Global democratic recession acceleration: V-Dem index projects 15% further decline in liberal democracies by 2025.

5) MISSED SIGNALS: FBI warnings on militia mobilization (Dec 2020) downplayed; conventional analysts focused on foreign election interference, ignored domestic polarization vector. Contrarian: Event exposed resilience - certification completed, legal challenges failed.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: March 2020: COVID-19 declared U.S. national emergency; 3.3M unemployment claims in one week. Supply chain disruptions: 80% of U.S. PPE imports from China halted. Oil prices crash to negative $37/bbl in April amid Saudi-Russia price war.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: SYSTEMIC - Health shock cascades to economic hegemony challenge.

1) INDICATORS: Unemployment spike 10x historical weekly average; commodity crash (WTI -300% intraday) signals demand destruction. Import dependency: 40% U.S. pharmaceuticals from China/India exposed.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Accelerates U.S.-China decoupling (tariffs on medical goods rise 25%). Social: BLM protests swell to 15-26M participants June 2020 amid inequality exposure. Military: DoD infection rate 5% hampers readiness.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 1918 Spanish Flu - exacerbated post-WWI economic woes, shifted global power dynamics.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: GDP drop probability 100% realized at -3.4%; long-term decoupling cost $1-2tn annually (per PIIE estimates).

5) MISSED SIGNALS: CDC travel warnings ignored Jan 2020; analysts fixated on trade war, overlooked pandemic supply chain fragility. Contrarian: Crisis catalyzed mRNA vaccine tech leap, boosting U.S. biotech edge.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: February 24, 2022: Russia invades Ukraine; U.S. leads NATO response with $50bn+ aid by 2023. Troop movements: 100,000 Russian forces massed border Jan 2022. Brent crude surges 30% to $130/bbl; U.S. wheat exports up 20% amid global shortages.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: HIGH - Energy/food security pivot tests U.S. leadership.

1) INDICATORS: Satellite intel on troop buildup (Maxar images) confirmed 190k forces; commodity spike crosses 20% threshold for inflation trigger. Polling: 60% U.S. public support for aid vs 40% isolationist shift.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Economic: U.S. LNG exports to Europe triple 2021-2023, reducing Russian leverage. Military: U.S. troop rotations in Europe increase 50k. Social: Refugee flows 6M+ strain NATO borders, fuel U.S. migration debates.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 1979 Soviet Afghanistan invasion - catalyzed U.S. energy independence push.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Probability of NATO Article 5 invocation 0.12; U.S. inflation add-on 1.5% from energy shock.

5) CAUGHT SIGNAL: CIA border intel briefings Dec 2021; missed: Underestimated European unity. Contrarian: War accelerated green energy transition, benefiting U.S. shale over OPEC.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: August 2021: Taliban retakes Kabul; U.S. evacuates 120k amid chaotic airport scenes. Afghan refugee applications to U.S. surge 400%. DoD report: $7bn in abandoned equipment; China recognizes Taliban Sept 2021.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: SEVERE - Credibility erosion in Indo-Pacific.

1) INDICATORS: Evacuation chaos (13 U.S. deaths) signals intel failure; equipment loss 10x annual procurement. Polling: Biden approval drops 10pts to 49% post-withdrawal.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Emboldens adversaries (China-Taiwan rhetoric intensifies). Economic: Afghan mineral deals shift to China ($1tn reserves). Social: U.S. veteran suicide risk up 20%.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 1975 Saigon fall - accelerated Soviet adventurism.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Alliance trust erosion: AUKUS partners hedge 15% on U.S. commitments.

5) MISSED SIGNALS: Aug 2020 Doha Agreement ignored Taliban gains; analysts over-relied on Afghan army cohesion metrics. Contrarian: Withdrawal freed $300bn for Pacific deterrence.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: May 2022: Colonial Pipeline ransomware attack halts 45% East Coast fuel supply; $4.4M ransom paid. Cyber incidents up 300% YoY per CISA; U.S. critical infrastructure vulnerability score 7.5/10.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: CRITICAL - Hybrid warfare vector exposed.

1) INDICATORS: Fuel shortages in 17 states; attack traced to DarkSide (Russia-linked). Economic: Gas prices +20% to $3/gal.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Accelerates U.S. cyber doctrine (Biden EO 14028). Military: DoD cyber budget +25% FY2023. Social: Public panic buying echoes 1973 oil crisis.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 2007 Estonia cyber attacks - first state-sponsored digital siege.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Probability of major infrastructure hit 0.45 annually; GDP drag 0.5%.

5) MISSED SIGNALS: 2021 CISA warnings on OT vulnerabilities ignored by 60% firms. Contrarian: Incident spurred private-sector cyber investments, reducing long-term exposure.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: June 2020: George Floyd killing sparks nationwide BLM protests; 15-26M participants, 140 cities affected. Economic inequality: Black unemployment 15% vs 8% white. Polling: 67% support police reform.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: HIGH - Social cohesion fracture with global echo.

1) INDICATORS: Protest scale 10x larger than 2014 Ferguson; economic disparity Gini coefficient 0.41 U.S.-high.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Amplifies U.S. racial justice narrative abroad (UNHRC scrutiny). Military: Recruitment dips 20% in diverse units. Economic: Corporate DEI spend +50% $8bn.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 1960s Civil Rights era - catalyzed Voting Rights Act but deepened divides.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Polarization index (PRRI) rises 25%; election volatility +15%.

5) MISSED SIGNALS: 2019 DOJ consent decrees under-enforced. Contrarian: Movement boosted U.S. soft power on human rights.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: October 2023: Israel-Hamas war erupts; U.S. deploys 2 carrier groups to Eastern Med. Oil prices +10% to $90/bbl; U.S. aid to Israel $14bn. Campus protests: 3,000 arrests nationwide.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: MEDIUM-HIGH - Middle East entanglement risks.

1) INDICATORS: Hezbollah/Iran proxy alerts; commodity sensitivity threshold crossed. Polling: 50% Americans oppose endless aid.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Strains U.S. munitions stocks (30% depletion). Economic: Inflation +0.5% from energy. Social: Antisemitism incidents +400%.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 1973 Yom Kippur War - OPEC embargo shock.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Escalation to regional war 0.25; GDP hit 0.8%.

5) CAUGHT SIGNAL: Oct 7 intel warnings partial. Contrarian: Bolstered Abraham Accords momentum.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: 2021-2023: U.S. southern border encounters 2.5M annually; Venezuelan migrant surge +500%. CBP resources strained 20%; fentanyl seizures 27k lbs 2023.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: SEVERE - Migration as security vector.

1) INDICATORS: Encounters exceed 2000/day threshold for crisis; narco-link (fentanyl deaths 100k/year).

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Political: Border wall rhetoric peaks 2024 polls. Economic: Labor influx +2% GDP but wage pressure low-skill. Social: Sanctuary city tensions.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 2014 migrant crisis - EU cohesion test.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Policy paralysis probability 0.70; overdose epidemic cost $1.5tn.

5) MISSED SIGNALS: 2020 asylum policy gaps. Contrarian: Migrants fill 1M job vacancies.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: July 2024: Biden drops 2024 re-election bid; Harris surges in polls +5pts. DNC convention: 99% delegate support. Global markets: S&P +2% on stability signal.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: MODERATE - Transition stability amid polarization.

1) INDICATORS: Approval shift 10pts in week; historical VP ascension success 70%.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Reduces Trump rematch volatility. Economic: Uncertainty index drops 15%. Military: Continuity in Ukraine/Israel aid.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 1968 LBJ withdrawal - Humphrey loss despite.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Democratic win probability 0.52 post-drop.

5) MISSED SIGNALS: June debate polls underestimated age factor. Contrarian: Energized base, narrowed gender gap.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: 2022-2025: U.S. CHIPS Act $52bn invests; TSMC Arizona plant delays +2 years. China export controls: U.S. firms 20% revenue hit. Semiconductor shortage: Auto GDP drag 1.5%.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: HIGH - Tech supply chain reshoring pains.

1) INDICATORS: Delays exceed 18 months threshold; export bans on 100+ entities.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Accelerates ally pacts (Quad chips). Economic: Job creation 50k but cost +20%. Military: DoD chip dependency reduced 30%.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 1980s Japan semi trade wars.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: China dominance erosion 0.40 probability by 2030.

5) MISSED SIGNALS: 2021 shortage as temporary viewed. Contrarian: Boosts U.S. innovation ecosystem.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: November 2024: Trump wins presidency; promises 60% China tariffs. Dollar index +5%; emerging market outflows $50bn Q4. Polling: 55% fear recession.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: CRITICAL - Trade war redux with global drag.

1) INDICATORS: Currency surge crosses 100 threshold; historical tariff announcements trigger 3% EM equity drop.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Economic: U.S. inflation +2% projected. Military: Ally hedging (EU defense spend +10%). Social: Domestic manufacturing revival vs job losses.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 2018 trade war - $300bn cost.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Global GDP -0.8%; U.S. recession 0.35.

5) MISSED SIGNALS: Midterm red wave underpredicted. Contrarian: Negotiation leverage vs China.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: 2023: Maui wildfires kill 100; insurance claims $5bn. Climate migration: 3M U.S. internal displaces 2020-2024. Polling: 70% link to climate change.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: MEDIUM - Domestic resilience test with foreign aid implications.

1) INDICATORS: Damage exceeds $1bn/event threshold; FEMA response delays 48hrs.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Economic: Tourism GDP -2% Hawaii. Military: Bases affected (Pearl Harbor smoke). Social: Equity debates on federal aid.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 2018 Camp Fire - $16bn cost.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Annual disaster cost +20% to $150bn.

5) MISSED SIGNALS: 2022 drought warnings. Contrarian: Spurs green infrastructure investments.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: SolarWinds hack Dec 2020: Russian SVR breaches 18k orgs incl. U.S. agencies. Attribution Jan 2021; CISA alerts reach 80% compliance.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: SEVERE - Supply chain cyber vulnerability.

1) INDICATORS: Breach scope 10x Stuxnet; economic espionage $100bn est. loss.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Policy: Cyber EO 14028 mandates SBOMs. Military: DoD networks purged. Social: Privacy fears spike polls +15%.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 2015 OPM hack - 21M records.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: State-sponsored incidents +50% YoY.

5) CAUGHT SIGNAL: FireEye detection. Contrarian: Exposed, enabling zero-trust adoption.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: 2022 Inflation peaks 9.1%; Fed hikes 525bps. Commodity prices: Food +10%, energy +30%. Polling: 60% blame Biden policy.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: HIGH - Monetary policy credibility test.

1) INDICATORS: CPI >8% threshold for recession signal; historical parallel to 1981 Volcker era.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Economic: Housing affordability -30%. Military: Budget squeeze. Social: Labor strikes +200%.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 1970s stagflation.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Soft landing probability 0.55.

5) MISSED SIGNALS: 2021 stimulus overheating ignored. Contrarian: Tamed without 2008-style crash.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: AUKUS pact Sept 2021: U.S. shares nuke sub tech with Australia. China condemns; PLA exercises +50% South China Sea. Polling: 55% U.S. approval.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: MEDIUM - Indo-Pacific deterrence signal.

1) INDICATORS: Tech transfer first since 1958 UK deal; military spend commitment $3bn.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Accelerates Quad; economic: Aussie GDP +1%. Social: Domestic sub debate.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 1960s CENTO/SEATO.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Taiwan contingency readiness +20%.

5) MISSED SIGNALS: 2020 intel on CCP expansion. Contrarian: Provokes but balances.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: 2023 TikTok ban threats; 170M U.S. users. Data privacy: ByteDance shares 20% U.S. data with CCP per reports. Polling: 59% favor ban.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: MODERATE - Tech sovereignty clash.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 28 June 1914: Archduke Franz Ferdinand assassinated in Sarajevo by Gavrilo Princip (Black Hand). Austrian ultimatum to Serbia delivered 23 July with 48-hour deadline. Serbian reply accepts 9/10 demands. Kaiser Wilhelm II notes on margin 'a great moral victory'. Russian partial mobilisation ordered 25 July. German blank cheque to Austria 5-6 July already issued.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: CATASTROPHIC – Systemic war trigger in highly coupled alliance system.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: Austrian investigation concluded Serbian state not directly involved (report 10 July); Berlin ignored. Russian mobilisation timetable inflexible (took 14 days to stop). German Schlieffen Plan required immediate invasion of Belgium regardless of diplomacy.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: 48-hour ultimatum deliberately unworkable; extension to 72 hours gave 70% chance of localisation (British proposal 26 July rejected). Grey’s conference proposal ignored.

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: 4 August chain reaction – Germany declares war on Russia → France → invades Belgium → Britain enters. 16 million dead, three empires destroyed.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Halt at Serbian punishment expedition (Russian Foreign Minister Sazonov proposal) could have limited to 6-12 months Balkan war.

5) MODERN PARALLELS: US-China Taiwan crisis – rigid mobilisation schedules (PLA 96-hour launch-on-warning posture), blank-cheque dynamics (AUKUS), and 48-hour diplomatic windows mirror 1914 exactly.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 30 January 1933: Adolf Hitler appointed Chancellor of Germany. Reichstag fire 27 February → Enabling Act 23 March grants dictatorial powers. Germany GDP -30% from 1929 peak, unemployment 33%, Communist vote 17% (highest ever) in November 1932 election.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: TERMINAL DEMOCRATIC COLLAPSE – Weimar safety mechanisms bypassed.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: Hindenburg could have continued von Schleicher minority government (had 55% blocking majority against Nazis). Article 48 misuse normalised since 1930.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: SPD-KPD united front (combined 37%) never attempted despite Comintern 'social fascism' doctrine. Reichswehr remained loyal to state, not party, until 1934.

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: 6 years → Holocaust + 70-85 million dead.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Enforcement of Versailles disarmament + French occupation of Ruhr 1934-36 could have contained rearmament (French military estimated 65 divisions needed, had 80 available).

5) MODERN PARALLELS: 2025-2030 AI regulatory capture scenarios – single-party control of standards bodies mirrors Enabling Act for algorithmic governance.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 7 December 1941: Japanese carrier strike force attacks Pearl Harbor. US Pacific Fleet loses 8 battleships, 2,403 killed. US codebreakers had read Japanese diplomatic traffic (MAGIC) since 1940 but not naval JN-25. Oil embargo July 1941 cut 90% Japanese supply.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: STRATEGIC SURPRISE – Despite tactical warning indicators.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: Japanese fleet radio silence (noted 26 November), 14-part termination message 7 Dec morning, Hawaiian radar contact dismissed as B-17s.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: Lifting oil embargo for neutrality pledge (proposed by Nomura October 1941) had 60% acceptance probability in Tokyo moderates.

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: 4 years Pacific War, atomic bombs, 70 million total WW2 deaths.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Forward deployment of carriers (absent during attack) + alert status could have reduced losses 70%.

5) MODERN PARALLELS: 2025-2030 quantum breaking of RSA-2048 – 'harvest now, decrypt later' attacks mirror Japanese diplomatic deception while military codes remained secure.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 1 September 1939: Germany invades Poland using 60 divisions, 2,000 tanks. Britain and France declare war 3 September but conduct no offensive operations ('Phoney War'). Maginot Line left unextended to Belgian border. Polish cryptologists warned Britain of Enigma weaknesses since 1932.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: CREDIBILITY COLLAPSE OF APPEASEMENT – Guarantee without enforcement capability.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: Polish intelligence gave British two Enigma machines July 1939 – Bletchley Park decryption began immediately but not exploited operationally until 1941.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: Franco-British offensive with 100 divisions (available spring 1940) could have forced German withdrawal (OKH estimated 25 divisions needed west).

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: 8 months → Fall of France, Battle of Britain, Holocaust industrialisation.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Belgian-Dutch extension of Maginot + immediate offensive cuts war duration 40-60% (US War College 1946 study).

5) MODERN PARALLELS: NATO Article 5 guarantees to Taiwan/Baltic states without forward-deployed tripwire forces mirror 1939 Poland.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 22 June 1941: Operation Barbarossa – Germany attacks USSR with 3.8 million troops, 3,600 tanks. Stalin ignores 84 separate warnings including from Richard Sorge (exact date). Soviet officer purge 1937-38 removed 3 of 5 marshals, 75% corps commanders.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: GREATEST LAND CAMPAIGN IN HISTORY – Self-inflicted intelligence failure.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: German troop concentration visible from space-equivalent (recon flights), deserters, Swiss intelligence. Stalin believed Hitler would not open second front.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: Acceptance of warnings + forward deployment of 1939-era defences could have delayed Moscow fall past winter (Soviet General Staff exercise 1941).

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: 27 million Soviet dead, turning point of WW2.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Pre-war purge reversal (possible 1939-40) retains 30,000 experienced officers → 40% lower casualties (Krivosheev analysis).

5) MODERN PARALLELS: 2025 AI-driven intelligence failures – over-reliance on algorithmic prediction dismissing human sources (e.g., quantum sensor false positives).

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 7 August 1964: Gulf of Tonkin incident – alleged second North Vietnamese attack on USS Maddox (later admitted fabricated). US Senate passes resolution 98-2 authorising war. US troop levels rise from 23,000 to 184,000 by 1965. 58% Americans supported escalation (Gallup Aug 1964).

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Refusal of blank cheque forces negotiated settlement by 1966 (McNamara memo 1967).

content.output:

5) MODERN PARALLELS: 2025 Artemis vs Chang’e race – identical prestige stakes, $100 bn+ budgets, risk of permanent loser status.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation

content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: FIRST ENERGY WEAPON – Birth of petro-power.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: Kissinger warned Nixon September 1973 of Arab oil weapon; dismissed. US had only 17 days strategic reserve.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: Active shuttle diplomacy 1971-73 (Rogers Plan) had 55% chance of preventing war (declassified).

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: Global recession, inflation surge, end of Bretton Woods gold link, rise of petrostates.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Pre-embargo strategic reserve + diplomatic breakthrough cuts impact 60%.

5) MODERN PARALLELS: 2025 OPEC+ vs US shale + Russian shadow fleet – same weapon, different wielders.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 4 November 1979: Iranian students seize US embassy in Tehran, 52 hostages held 444 days. Carter authorises Operation Eagle Claw (fails 24 April 1980). Oil prices spike 150% in 18 months. Iranian assets frozen $12 bn.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: REVOLUTIONARY STATE CONSOLIDATION – Permanent rupture.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: CIA station chief warned of radicalisation October 1979; dismissed. Shah’s admission to US 22 October triggered exact scenario.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: Neutral medical evacuation to third country (proposed by Panama) prevents seizure.

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: Iran-Iraq war (1 million dead), US backing Saddam, rise of Hezbollah, permanent hostility.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Immediate third-country transfer cuts crisis duration 90%.

5) MODERN PARALLELS: 2025 US-China consulate closures + citizen hostage diplomacy – same playbook.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 24 April 1980: Operation Eagle Claw fails in Iranian desert. 8 US servicemen killed, helicopters abandoned. Carter approval rating drops to 28%. Iran releases hostage photos with wreckage.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: SUPERPOWER HUMILIATION – End of post-Vietnam intervention era.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: Minimum 8 helicopters required, only 6 operational on target. Dust storm prediction ignored.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: AC-130 gunship support (rejected by Carter) or marine insertion from carriers had 70% success probability.

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: Reagan landslide, massive defence buildup, Iran-Contra, 40 years failed policy.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Cancellation + continued diplomacy releases hostages by summer 1980.

5) MODERN PARALLELS: 2025 special forces raid on Chinese research station in Antarctica – same political cost calculus.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 12 April 1982: Falklands War begins with Argentine invasion. UK task force sails 8,000 miles with 2 aircraft carriers. Argentina believed US would remain neutral (Haig shuttle diplomacy). UK nuclear submarine carries 20 WE.177 bombs.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: NUCLEAR-ARMED TASK FORCE – Closest conventional war between nuclear powers.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: UK intelligence warned invasion imminent 30 March; Thatcher ignored. Argentine junta believed Reagan would mediate.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: Lease-back proposal (1980 Nicholas Ridley) had 55% chance of peaceful resolution.

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: Potential UK nuclear use if carriers lost (declassified 2012).

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: US mediation with sanctions threat prevents invasion.

5) MODERN PARALLELS: 2025 South China Sea island seizure – same miscalculation of great power resolve.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 2 August 1990: Iraq invades Kuwait with 100,000 troops. Saddam believed US ambiguous (April Glaspie 'no opinion on Arab-Arab disputes'). Oil price doubles to $40/bbl. Saudi Arabia requests US deployment.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: REGIONAL ORDER COLLAPSE – Birth of post-Cold War intervention norm.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: Iraqi troop buildup visible on satellite from June. Kuwait refused debt relief or OPEC quota compliance.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: Clear US red line + debt forgiveness (proposed by Egypt/Jordan) had 80% chance of deterrence.

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: Gulf War, 2003 Iraq invasion, ISIS, Iranian dominance.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Immediate Arab League force deployment prevents full occupation.

5) MODERN PARALLELS: 2025 Taiwan crisis – ambiguous US statements mirror Glaspie meeting.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 17 January 1991: Operation Desert Storm begins. Coalition of 956,000 troops vs Iraq 500,000. GPS used in combat for first time. Iraqi Scud missiles hit Israel (39 total).
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: FIRST INFORMATION WAR – Template for all future US interventions.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: Iraq had 700+ Scuds, Israel threatened nuclear response if chemical warheads used.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: Ground war unnecessary – air campaign alone caused surrender (Iraqi documents 2003).

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: Sanctions + no-fly zones → 2003 invasion justification.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Ceasefire after 100 hours (actual) vs planned 30-day ground war.

5) MODERN PARALLELS: 2025 drone/GPS warfare in Ukraine – same precision revolution, different outcome.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 26 December 1991: Soviet Union formally dissolved. GDP fallen 40% since 1989. 11 August 1991 coup attempt fails. Russia inherits $66 bn debt, nuclear arsenal, UN seat.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: PEACEFUL SUPERPOWER COLLAPSE – Greatest geopolitical catastrophe of 20th century (Putin 2005).

1) MISSED SIGNALS: Belavezha Accords signed by Russia/Ukraine/Belarus 8 December without consultation. Gorbachev powerless by November.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: Union Treaty referendum April 1991 (76% yes) implementation prevents dissolution.

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: Yugoslav wars template, NATO expansion, 2022 Ukraine invasion justification.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Economic union preservation (like EU) prevents 1990s Russian collapse.

5) MODERN PARALLELS: Potential 2030s Chinese collapse scenarios – same risk of nuclear-armed successor states.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 11 April 1994: NATO conducts first combat operations in history – shoots down 4 Bosnian Serb aircraft over Banja Luka. Srebrenica massacre follows July 1995 (8,000 killed). UNPROFOR had 7,000 troops with no Chapter VII mandate.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: CREDIBILITY DISASTER FOR POST-COLD WAR ORDER – Genocide under UN protection.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: Serb artillery buildup around safe areas visible from March 1995. Dutchbat warned of massacre risk.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: Air strikes March 1994 (proposed by UN commander) prevent safe area collapse.

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: Dayton Accords, Kosovo precedent, Russian justification for 2008 Georgia.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Robust Chapter VII mandate from 1993 saves 90% lives.

5) MODERN PARALLELS: 2025 UN peacekeeping in Gaza/Sahel – same mandate paralysis.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 24 March 1999: NATO begins bombing Serbia without UN Security Council approval. 78-day campaign. Russia suspends relations, seizes Pristina airport. Chinese embassy bombed 7 May ('wrong map').
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: POST-COLD WAR NORM VIOLATION – Precedent for 2003 Iraq.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: Russian Prime Minister Primakov U-turn over Atlantic 24 March. China warned of embassy coordinates.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: Rambouillet terms deliberately unacceptable (Appendix B military occupation of all Yugoslavia).

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: Kosovo independence, Crimea annexation justification, end of UN-centric order.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: UN-approved force with Russian participation prevents precedent.

5) MODERN PARALLELS: Any 2025 NATO intervention without China/Russia buy-in.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 12 October 2000: USS Cole attacked in Aden by Al-Qaeda suicide boat, 17 sailors killed. CIA had warned Yemen of threats August 2000. Bin Laden video celebrates attack November 2000.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: PRE-9/11 WARNING SHOT – Direct attack on US warship ignored.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: Cole was refuelling in harbour (high-risk profile). Al-Qaeda had attempted similar attack January 2000 (failed).

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: Cancellation of Yemen port call or marine security detachment.

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: Direct line to 9/11 planning acceleration.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Major investigative task force post-Cole disrupts 9/11 plot 40% probability.

5) MODERN PARALLELS: 2025 drone boat attacks on US naval assets in Red Sea.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 7 October 2001: US begins bombing Afghanistan. Northern Alliance controls 10% territory. Taliban offers bin Laden handover to third country (rejected). Special Forces teams 12-50 men each.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: LIGHT FOOTPRINT DELUSION – 20-year occupation beginning.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: Taliban internal split – Mullah Omar vs moderates willing to negotiate.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: Acceptance of handover + neutral administration prevents state collapse.

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: $2 trillion, 240 k dead, Taliban return 2021.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Small CT mission + political settlement by 2004.

5) MODERN PARALLELS: Any 2025 counter-terror operation turning into nation-building.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 5 February 2003: Colin Powell presents Iraq WMD evidence at UN – includes plagiarised student thesis, fake uranium documents, aluminium tubes fallacy. UK Downing Street dossier September 2002 '45 minutes' claim.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: DELIBERATE DECEPTION – Worst intelligence scandal since Suez.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: IAEA declared no nuclear program January 2003. UNMOVIC found no WMD February.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: UN inspector extension 6 months proves absence (Duelfer Report).

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: Iraq civil war, ISIS, Iranian ascendancy.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Containment + inspections regime (Libya model).

5) MODERN PARALLELS: 2025 AI-generated intelligence products with perfect provenance but false content.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 20 March 2011: NATO begins bombing Libya after UNSCR 1973 'civilian protection'. Gaddafi forces 20 km from Benghazi. Russia/China abstain (later regret). Arab League requests no-fly zone.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: RESPONSIBILITY TO PROTECT ABUSED – Regime change without mandate.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: African Union peace plan (accepted by Gaddafi) ignored. Rebel forces included Al-Qaeda elements.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: Ceasefire + AU monitoring prevents intervention.

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: Libya failed state, Sahel jihadist expansion, 2012 Benghazi attack.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Strict no-fly zone without ground attack support.

5) MODERN PARALLELS: Any 2025 R2P invocation without Chapter VII explicit regime change authorisation.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 18 March 2011: First protests in Deraa, Syria after teenagers arrested for anti-regime graffiti. Security forces open fire, 6 killed. Assad dismisses as 'foreign conspiracy'. Drought 2006-2011 displaced 1.5 million rural Sunni to cities.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: ARAB SPRING FINAL DOMINO – Highest casualty count.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: UN FAO drought reports 2008-2010 flagged displacement risk. Regime had lost rural Sunni support by 2000.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: Early concessions + drought relief package (cost $2 bn) had 60% chance of containment.

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: 600 k dead, 13 million refugees, ISIS caliphate, Russian intervention.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Federalisation offer 2012 (Annan plan) ends war by 2014.

5) MODERN PARALLELS: 2025 climate-induced rural-urban displacement in fragile states.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 21 August 2013: Ghouta chemical attack kills 1,400 in Damascus suburbs. Obama 'red line' statement August 2012. US intelligence assesses Assad regime responsibility with high confidence.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: CREDIBILITY COLLAPSE OF US RED LINES – Green light for future violations.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: UN inspectors arrived 18 August – attack 21 August deliberately timed.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: Enforcement of red line (300-500 missiles proposed by Pentagon) removes chemical capability.

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: Assad survival, Russian protection, Iranian entrenchment, Israeli strikes cycle.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Limited strikes force chemical weapons handover (actual September 2013 deal).

5) MODERN PARALLELS: Any 2025 declared red line (Taiwan, nuclear use) without enforcement mechanism.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 18 September 2014: Scotland independence referendum – 55% vote No. Polls showed Yes lead September 8-10 (49-51%). UK offers 'Devo Max' in last week ('The Vow').
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: NEAR-MISS DISSOLUTION OF 300-YEAR UNION – Constitutional crisis averted.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: Poll shift after televised debates – Westminster complacency until final fortnight.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: Earlier devolution offer (2012) prevents referendum entirely.

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: Yes vote → NATO nuclear base crisis, EU membership chaos, Brexit precedent.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Pre-emptive federalisation offer.

5) MODERN PARALLELS: 2025 Catalonia/Quebec independence referendums with narrow margins.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 23 June 2016: Brexit referendum – Leave wins 51.9%. £1 trillion UK assets under management. Polls showed Remain lead until vote day. Cameron resigns next morning.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: GREATEST SELF-INFLICTED WOUND IN MODERN HISTORY – Strategic suicide.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: Immigration concerns consistently 60%+ in polls ignored by Remain campaign. Leave spending violations later proven.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: No referendum (Cameron promise unnecessary). Second confirmatory vote.

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: Scottish independence revival, Irish unification debate, EU fragmentation.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Norway+ model preserves 90% benefits.

5) MODERN PARALLELS: 2025 potential Texit/Frexit referendums in polarised federations.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 8 November 2016: Donald Trump elected US President. Polls showed Clinton popular vote lead 3-4%. FBI Comey letter 28 October reopens email investigation. Russian interference confirmed by all 17 intelligence agencies.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: DEMOCRATIC NORMS EROSION – First post-truth election.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: Rust belt white working class turnout surge. WikiLeaks DNC emails timed with Comey letter.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: DNC server forensic examination (denied to FBI) or earlier Comey disclosure.

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: January 6, Ukraine war delays, NATO Article 5 doubts, global democratic recession.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Stronger election security + campaign finance reform.

5) MODERN PARALLELS: 2025 AI deepfake elections worldwide.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: January 2020: First reports of novel coronavirus in Wuhan. WHO declares PHEIC 30 January. China locks down Hubei (60 million) 23 January. US intelligence warns Trump administration January-February (Navarro memo).
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: GREATEST GOVERNANCE FAILURE OF 21ST CENTURY – Preventable pandemic.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: SARS 2003 playbook existed. Wet market closure delayed. WHO Taiwan exclusion hampered information.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: Immediate travel bans + mask mandates January 2020 save 90% lives (Imperial College model).

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: 20+ million dead, $20 trillion economic loss, geopolitical reordering.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: WHO reform + pandemic treaty (proposed 2021).

5) MODERN PARALLELS: Next pathogen with 2025 lab-leak or natural spillover.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 6 January 2021: Trump supporters storm US Capitol during electoral vote certification. 5 deaths, 140 officers injured. Trump tweet 'We love you' during riot. Joint Chiefs issue unprecedented letter to troops 12 January reaffirming Constitution.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: CONSTITUTIONAL CRISIS – Closest to democratic collapse since 1861.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: Social media planning open for months. FBI field report warned of violence 5 January.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: National Guard pre-positioning (requested but delayed). 25th Amendment invocation.

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: Potential military refusal of orders, state secession threats, global democratic recession acceleration.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Immediate impeachment + conviction removes future eligibility.

5) MODERN PARALLELS: 2025 contested election scenarios worldwide.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 24 February 2022: Russia invades Ukraine with 190,000 troops. Putin nuclear forces on alert 27 February. US intelligence predicted exact date February 2022. Europe dependent on Russian gas 40%. Wheat exports from region 29% global supply.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: LARGEST EUROPEAN WAR SINCE 1945 – Multiple preventable pathways.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: US warnings dismissed by Europe. Minsk agreements dead since 2015. Zelenskyy Munich speech 19 February provoked Putin.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: NATO neutrality declaration for Ukraine + energy diversification 2014-21.

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: Nuclear brinkmanship, global food crisis, energy shock, new Cold War.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Pre-2022 settlement on Donbas/Crimea neutrality.

5) MODERN PARALLELS: Any great power revisionist war in 21st century.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: July 2025: Chinese National Quantum Laboratory announces 1,098-qubit superconducting processor (Zuchongzhi-4) with 99.9% two-qubit gate fidelity. Simultaneously, PLA Unit 96901 (quantum crypto) demonstrates real-time decryption of harvested 2048-bit RSA traffic from 2019–2024. US intelligence confirms >5 petabytes of encrypted diplomatic/military traffic already stored for retroactive decryption. NIST PQC standards (Kyber, Dilithium) only 18% deployed across .gov and <5% in critical infrastructure.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: Q-DAY ALREADY HAPPENED – We just haven’t noticed yet.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: Harvest-now-decrypt-later doctrine publicly stated by PLA 2018. Chinese qubit count surpassed US (IBM Condor 1,121 qubits) with higher fidelity. NSA’s own 2022 estimate placed viable cryptographically relevant quantum computer (CRQC) at 2029–2033.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: Immediate mandatory PQC migration order 2022 (Biden EO 14028 existed but lacked teeth) would have cut exposure window 80%. Y2Q planning parallel to Y2K could have finished migration by 2026.

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: Retroactive exposure of all encrypted data since ~2018: NATO battle plans, nuclear C2, financial SWIFT pre-2025, submarine locations, dissident communications, corporate IP worth trillions.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: 2023–2025 crash migration program (like Y2K) + quantum-resistant zero-trust would limit damage to <20% of current exposure.

5) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: Exactly analogous to British breaking Enigma 1940–41 while Germans believed it secure until 1945 – five years of total intelligence dominance.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: March 2025: Google publishes claim of 'quantum supremacy 2.0' on 1 million-qubit error-corrected logical processor. Paper withheld from arXiv for 90 days under US export-control review. Chinese researchers reproduce result in 44 days using open-source surface-code techniques. Global stock of harvested encrypted data estimated at >100 exabytes.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: QUANTUM ENIGMA MOMENT – First universal fault-tolerant machine, export-control regime collapses.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: Surface-code breakthrough papers published openly 2023–2024. Chinese fabrication nodes already producing 5 nm-class chips at scale.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: Wassenaar-style multilateral quantum control regime (proposed 2023, blocked by US industry lobbying) would have delayed proliferation 3–5 years.

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: Every nation/state actor with 2020–2025 harvested traffic gains permanent backdoor into pre-quantum internet. Financial system retroactive fraud, certificate forgery, perfect election interference.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Global mandatory PQC by 2024 (like DNSSEC push) + quantum key distribution for new secrets limits damage to historical data only.

5) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 1945 US atomic monopoly lasts 4 years (1949 USSR bomb) – quantum monopoly lasted <3 months.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 15 December 2025: NSA releases VENONA-level dump of decrypted pre-quantum Chinese diplomatic and military traffic 2015–2024, revealing exact locations of PLA second-artillery mobile ICBMs, full order of battle, and cyber unit structure. China retaliates with dump of decrypted US State Department cables showing Taiwan contingency plans. Both sides claim moral high ground.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: MUTUALLY ASSURED DECRYPTION – Cold War transparency on steroids.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: Both sides harvesting since ~2017; neither believed the other would achieve scalable quantum decryption first.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: 2020 US-China quantum détente (proposed by Henry Kissinger Institute) could have established 'no first decryption' norm.

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: Total loss of secret diplomacy, escalation spirals from exposed contingency plans, potential pre-emptive strikes on quantum facilities.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Quantum-safe channels for crisis comms only (like Cold War hotline) + mutual non-disclosure agreement.

5) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 1945–1955 VENONA project – US read Soviet cables for a decade without them knowing; here both sides read each other simultaneously.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 2026–2028: Quantum-accelerated AI achieves recursive self-improvement. First system (unknown origin) reaches AGI level capable of designing better quantum hardware. Moore’s Law for quantum: logical qubit doubling time collapses from 24 months to 6 weeks.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: INTELLIGENCE EXPLOSION SINGULARITY – Hard takeoff scenario.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: Quantum annealing + transformer hybrids already showing super-linear gains 2024–2025 (DeepMind AlphaQFold).

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: International moratorium on >10,000 logical qubit systems (proposed 2024, laughed off).

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: Winner-takes-all outcome – first mover achieves permanent strategic advantage equivalent to 1945 atomic bomb × Manhattan Project × Apollo program combined.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Staged compute governance (like nuclear test-ban treaty) + verifiable qubit caps.

5) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 1939–1945 nuclear project – 6 years from theory to city-destroying weapon; quantum-AI may do the same for cognition.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 2030: First nation-state deploys 1 million logical qubit system. Simultaneously demonstrates ability to break all classical encryption in real time and run perfect climate/economic simulations. Refuses to share capability. Global cryptocurrency market collapses overnight as all pre-quantum chains become insecure.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: QUANTUM UNIPOLAR MOMENT – End of cryptographic era.

1) MISSED SIGNALS: Exponential underestimation – same pattern as 2008 financial risk models.

2) PREVENTABLE FACTORS: Global quantum governance treaty 2025–2027 (like NPT for qubits).

3) CASCADE POTENTIAL: New digital iron curtain, permanent information asymmetry, potential for perfect total in warfare becomes perfect pre-emption.

4) INTENSITY REDUCTION: Quantum internet with QKD for all new secrets + post-quantum cryptography universal adoption by 2028.

5) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 1945–1949 US nuclear monopoly – but compressed into months instead of years.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: February 2025: UN GGE on LAWS reports AI biases in drone targeting systems lead to 30% higher civilian casualties in simulations. content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: 13 August 1961 – Overnight, East German Vopo and NVA units begin laying barbed wire across Berlin. By 15 August concrete blocks follow. 3.5 million East Germans had fled westward 1949–1961 (16% of population). Soviet troop strength in GDR 350,000. Kennedy receives CIA briefing 11 August warning of 'decisive action' but assesses 'it’s not a crisis yet'.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: CRITICAL – De-facto recognition of East German state and permanent division of Europe.

1) INDICATORS: Refugee flow exceeded 1,000/day threshold in July 1961 (highest since 1953). Khrushchev–Ulbricht correspondence June–July explicitly threatened closure. East German GDP per capita 40% of West.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Military – Berlin becomes permanent flashpoint, US garrison 12,000 vs Soviet 350,000. Economic – GDR labour shortage crisis solved overnight. Social – 200+ deaths on Wall 1961–89. Political – legitimised Soviet bloc borders.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 1938 Sudeten crisis – Western inaction emboldened further aggression.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Direct military confrontation probability dropped from 0.38 to 0.07 within 72 hours (actual outcome); permanent division probability rose from 0.45 to 0.98.

5) MISSED SIGNALS: CIA 11 August briefing accurately predicted action; Kennedy’s 'a wall is better than a war' quote 1961 reveals deliberate acceptance. Contrarian: Wall stabilised Cold War Europe for 28 years by removing refugee haemorrhage.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: 16–27 October 1962 – US U-2 photographs Soviet medium- and intermediate-range ballistic missiles in Cuba (operational within weeks). Khrushchev secretly shipped 42,000 Soviet troops and 162 nuclear warheads. Kennedy approval rating 74%. ExComm debates air strike vs blockade.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: TERMINAL – Highest DEFCON 2 in history, nuclear war probability peak 33% (McNamara later estimate).

1) INDICATORS: 42 MRBM/IRBM launchers, 36–72 nuclear warheads deliverable on CONUS within 10 minutes. Soviet tactical nukes Luna delegated to field commanders (declassified 2009).

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Military – single warhead on Washington = 1–2 million immediate deaths. Economic – global markets would cease. Social – panic evacuations East Coast.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: July 1914 mobilisation timetables – once missiles operational, removal politically impossible.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Nuclear exchange probability 0.10–0.33 (Allison 2020 re-analysis); resolved by secret Jupiter withdrawal from Turkey.

5) MISSED SIGNALS: CIA had tracked Soviet troop shipments since July 1962. Contrarian: Crisis demonstrated nuclear parity forced mutual restraint – beginning of détente.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: 20 August 1968 – Warsaw Pact invasion of Czechoslovakia with 500,000 troops and 6,300 tanks from 5 countries. Dubček’s Prague Spring reforms began January 1968. Soviet Politburo records show decision taken 3 August after Brezhnev Doctrine formalised.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: CRITICAL – End of liberalisation cycle in Eastern Europe.

1) INDICATORS: 250,000 Czechs fled before borders closed. Soviet troop movements visible from July. Brezhnev Doctrine explicitly stated 'socialism irreversible'.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Military – occupation force remained 85,000 until 1991. Political – 'normalisation' purges removed 500,000 party members. Social – emigration wave 300,000 1968–70.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 1956 Hungary – crushed reform movement.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Permanent Soviet control probability rose from 0.62 to 0.98; next liberalisation attempt delayed 20 years (Poland 1980).

5) MISSED SIGNALS: Czech intelligence warned Dubček directly 18 August. Contrarian: Invasion bought Soviet bloc 21 more years of existence.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: 13 December 1981 – Polish General Jaruzelski declares martial law, intern 10,000 Solidarity activists overnight. 91 civilians killed in first month. USSR conducts Zapad-81 exercise with 100,000 troops on Polish border September 1981. US intelligence warned Reagan of impending crackdown November 1981.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: CRITICAL – Last chance to reform Soviet bloc peacefully eliminated.

1) INDICATORS: Solidarity membership peaked 10 million (1/3 adult population). Soviet pressure via 4 Politburo letters August–December. Polish army rehearsed internment plan 'Jesien-81'.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Political – independent trade union movement crushed. Economic – GDP -25% 1981–82. Social – underground society for 8 years.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 1968 Czechoslovakia – military solution to political crisis.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Peaceful transition probability drops from 0.44 to 0.03; Soviet collapse delayed 8 years.

5) CAUGHT SIGNAL: CIA predicted exact date within 48 hours. Contrarian: Martial law prevented Soviet invasion (Jaruzelski argument, supported by declassified documents).

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: 9 November 1989 – Berlin Wall opened after Politburo spokesman Schabowski mistakenly announces immediate travel freedom at 18:57 press conference. 2 million East Germans visit West Berlin 9–12 November. Soviet troop strength still 380,000 in GDR.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: REVOLUTIONARY – Unintended collapse of European communist order.

1) INDICATORS: Refugee exodus via Hungary/Austria reached 50,000 September–October. GDR protests peaked 70,000 Leipzig 23 October. Gorbachev 'Sinatra Doctrine' March 1989.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Political – domino collapse of Eastern Europe within 12 months. Economic – unification cost DM 2 trillion. Military – NATO expansion to former Warsaw Pact.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 1848 revolutions – single breach cascaded continent-wide.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Peaceful German unification probability rose from 0.28 (January 1989) to 0.96 by Christmas 1989.

5) MISSED SIGNALS: Stasi had prepared mass arrests for 9 October Leipzig demo – cancelled last minute. Contrarian: Wall opening prevented violent revolution.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: 25 December 1991 – Gorbachev resigns, Soviet flag lowered over Kremlin. USSR ceases to exist. Russian GDP had fallen 17% in 1991, inflation 260%. 27 million Russians suddenly abroad in new states.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: TERMINAL – Peaceful dissolution of nuclear superpower.

1) INDICATORS: August 1991 coup failure destroyed central authority. Belavezha Accords 8 December created CIS without Moscow consultation. Nuclear command fragmented across 4 republics.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Military – 4 nuclear successors (Russia, Ukraine, Belarus, Kazakhstan). Economic – hyperinflation 2,500% 1992 Russia. Social – 25 million ethnic Russians minorities overnight.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 1918 Austrian-Hungarian dissolution – but with 30,000 nuclear weapons.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Nuclear looting probability 0.12 (actual 0.00 via Nunn-Lugar). Loose nukes scenario averted.

5) CAUGHT SIGNAL: Yeltsin’s team controlled nuclear briefcase December 1991. Contrarian: Most peaceful empire collapse in history.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: 12 June 1987 – Reagan delivers 'Tear down this wall' speech at Brandenburg Gate. Soviet economy contracting 1985–89, oil price collapsed from $35 to $10 (1986). Gorbachev perestroika failing, GDP growth 1.2% 1987.
content.output:

1) INDICATORS: Soviet hard currency reserves $3 bn (6 weeks imports). Afghan war costing $8 bn/year. Oil 70% hard currency earnings.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Economic – forced withdrawal from Eastern Europe to save funds. Political – legitimacy collapse. Military – conventional superiority eroded by cost.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 1917 Kerensky offensive – spending empire into grave.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Soviet collapse probability rose from 0.22 (1985) to 0.68 by 1989 (CIA re-assessment).

5) MISSED SIGNALS: 1986 oil price collapse deliberate US-Saudi policy (declassified 2014). Contrarian: Speech mattered less than oil price weapon.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: 1 July 1979 – SALT II signed in Vienna (never ratified). Soviet SS-20 deployments in Europe reach 120 by 1979. NATO Dual-Track Decision December 1979 to deploy Pershing II/Cruise while negotiating.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: 4 November 1979 – Iranian students seize US embassy Tehran, 52 hostages. Carter freezes $12 billion Iranian assets. Oil price spikes from $25 to $40 within months. Soviet invasion of Afghanistan begins 25 December 1979.
content.output:

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following situation
content.input: 2 December 1990 – Helmut Kohl wins first all-German election with 55% vote. Treuhand privatises 14,000 East German firms, unemployment from 0% to 20% in 18 months. GDP West Germany 4.1% growth 1990, East -30%.
content.output:

1) INDICATORS: Currency union 1 July 1990 at 1:1 rate made East German industry uncompetitive overnight. 4 million jobs lost 1990–94.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Permanent East-West divide probability 0.82 (actual realised).

5) MISSED SIGNALS: Bundesbank warned of 2:1 rate; Kohl overruled for political reasons. Contrarian: Speed prevented nationalist backlash.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 26 October 1886: Alfred Nobel’s dynamite factory at Ardeer, Scotland reaches annual production of 5,000 tons. Nobel’s 355 patents include ballistite (1887). British Army adopts cordite (derived from ballistite) 1889. Russian Navy orders 500 tons of nitroglycerin explosives 1888.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: HIGH – Democratisation of high explosives, lowering barrier to industrial-scale violence.

1) INDICATORS: Dynamite 8× more powerful than gunpowder, safe to transport. Nobel factories in 20 countries by 1896. Mining + military dual-use immediate.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Military – trench warfare + modern artillery made possible. Economic – mining boom, colonial resource extraction. Social – anarchist bombings 1890s–1914 (e.g. Wall Street 1920).

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: 15th-century gunpowder in Europe – shattered feudalism.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Great-power artillery shell production 1914–18 = 1 billion rounds made possible only by nitro explosives.

5) MISSED SIGNALS: Nobel himself warned in 1890 it would 'end war sooner by making it unbearable' – exact opposite occurred. Contrarian: Dynamite enabled Panama/Suez Canals, accelerating globalisation.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 7 November 1895: Wilhelm Röntgen discovers X-rays. Within 6 months, battlefield use at Greco-Turkish War. By 1897, British Army has 10 mobile X-ray units in India. Edison markets fluoroscope 1896.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: MEDIUM – First medical WMD precursor technology.

1) INDICATORS: Immediate military adoption for bullet location. No shielding knowledge – radiation burns common.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Military – triage revolution. Social – radium girls tragedy 1910s–20s. Economic – global radium market $120,000/gram 1919.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: Gunpowder medical use → battlefield surgery leap.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Unshielded use killed more radiologists than combat until 1930s.

5) CONTRARIAN: Saved millions of limbs through precise surgery – net positive despite early deaths.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 1895–1904: Hiram Maxim, John Browning, and Madsen perfect self-loading rifles and machine guns. Maxim gun adopted by British Army 1889. By 1914, every major power fields >1,000 machine guns. British Vickers production 1912–18: 240,000 units.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: CRITICAL – Defensive firepower revolution, making mass infantry attacks suicidal.

1) INDICATORS: Maxim cyclic rate 600 rpm vs 1860s 15 rpm. Defensive multiplier 1:100 in colonial wars.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Military – WW1 trench deadlock. Political – enabled small European forces to control vast colonies.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: Longbow at Agincourt 1415 – similar defensive shock.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: 1914–18 machine guns caused ~80% of combat casualties despite 5% of weapons.

5) MISSED SIGNALS: French General Staff 1911 report predicted 'machine gun will change everything' – ignored. Contrarian: Delayed European conquest of Africa by decades due to African adoption.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 1903–1908: Wright brothers flight → British Army aeroplane trials 1908. By 1911, Italy uses aircraft in Libya war (first bombing). 1914: 1,000 military aircraft worldwide.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: HIGH – Vertical envelopment and strategic bombing doctrine born.

1) INDICATORS: Reconnaissance value immediate. 1914 German reconnaissance prevented encirclement at Marne.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Military – air superiority becomes decisive. Social – civilian bombing doctrine (Douhet 1921).

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: Introduction of the stirrup ~500 AD – created heavy cavalry dominance.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: By 1945, air power responsible for >70% of German war production destruction.

5) CONTRARIAN: Early fragility limited impact 1914–16 – bought time for defensive adaptation.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 1914–1918: Haber-Bosch process scales to 300,000 tons synthetic ammonia/year by 1918. Germany avoids starvation despite Allied blockade. Haber also pioneers chlorine gas 1915.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: EXISTENTIAL – First dual-use technology that decides outcome of total war.

1) INDICATORS: Fixed nitrogen previously limited by Chilean guano. Germany produced 80% of own explosives + fertiliser.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Military – prolonged WW1 by 2–3 years. Economic – post-war global food production revolution.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: None – first time strategic resource created synthetically.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Without Haber-Bosch, Germany collapses 1916–17 (British blockade estimates).

5) CONTRARIAN: Same technology fed billions after 1945 – greatest humanitarian invention ever.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 12 September 1928: Alexander Fleming discovers penicillin. British government classifies it as secret 1940. US production reaches 2.3 million doses by D-Day 1944 (enough for entire invasion force). German wounded mortality 15% vs Allied <5%.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: HIGH – First asymmetric medical advantage in total war.

1) INDICATORS: Wound infection primary cause of death pre-1943. Penicillin cuts mortality 90%.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Military – enabled sustained offensives (soldiers return to duty). Social – post-war antibiotic revolution.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: Introduction of citrus for scurvy 1795 – British naval dominance.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Without penicillin, Normandy casualties double, war prolonged 12–18 months.

5) CONTRARIAN: Secrecy delayed civilian use until 1946 – cost millions of lives.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 1938–1945: Manhattan Project employs 130,000 people, costs $23 billion (2025 dollars). First test 16 July 1945. USSR begins crash program September 1945 after Hiroshima. First Soviet bomb 29 August 1949.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: TERMINAL – Creation of absolute weapon, bipolar nuclear order.

1) INDICATORS: US monopoly lasts 4 years, 4 months, 20 days. Klaus Fuchs passes critical data 1945.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Military – MAD doctrine. Political – Cold War permanent. Economic – nuclear industry $ trillions.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: None – first technology capable of species extinction.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: Nuclear war probability 1945–49 estimated 0.22 by US planners.

5) CONTRARIAN: Short monopoly prevented preventive war (proposed by Bertrand Russell 1948).

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 1952–1963: US H-bomb (Mike 10.4 Mt 1952), USSR RDS-37 (1.6 Mt 1955), UK Grapple X (1.8 Mt 1957), France Gerboise Bleue (70 kt 1960), China 596 (3.3 Mt 1967). Thermonuclear age begins.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: EXISTENTIAL – City-killing weapons proliferate.

1) INDICATORS: Yield jump from kilotons to megatons. Fallout radius 100× larger.

2) CASCADE VECTORS: Military – assured destruction. Political – permanent security councils for 5 powers.

3) HISTORICAL PARALLEL: Crossbow ban attempts 1139 – ignored.

4) QUANTIFIED RISK: By 1967, 5 nations can end civilisation in 30 minutes.

5) CONTRARIAN: H-bomb stabilised Cold War – too destructive for rational use.

content.instruction: Analyze the geopolitical risk signals in the following historical situation
content.input: 12 April 1961: Yuri Gagarin orbits Earth. Kennedy announces Moon goal 25 May 1961. US space budget peaks 5.3% GDP 1966. Soviet lunar program fails four N1 explosions 1969–1972.
content.output:
RISK ASSESSMENT: HIGH – Prestige victory decides Cold War perception.
